Digital Notebook: In the absence of paper, the first and most obvious solution would be to switch to digital means of recording information. This could mean using a smartphone or tablet to take notes, or using a dedicated digital notebook app. The advantage of this method is that it is easily accessible, searchable, and can be shared with others.

Audio Recording: Another option would be to record important information using audio. This could be done using a smartphone or a dedicated audio recorder. The advantage of this method is that it is easy to and allows for more detailed and accurate record-keeping.

Video Recording: Video recording could also be used to document important information. This could be done using a smartphone or a dedicated video camera. The advantage of this method is that it allows for visual documentation and can be used to and important events.

3D Printing: If 3D printing technology was available, it could be used to create physical copies of important documents. This would the need for paper and make it possible to keep important information in a physical format.

Holographic Displays: Holographic displays could be used to display important information in a three-dimensional format. This would be a more futuristic solution, but it could be used to display information in a way that is more visually appealing and easier to understand.
